questions.question_text: Which of the following is the MOST important characteristic of a key risk indicator (KRI) to enable decision-making?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Illustrating changes in risk trends
Keyword: risk trend

Selected Answer: D
The most important characteristic of a key risk indicator (KRI) to enable decision-making is illustrating changes in risk trends (option D).

The core purpose of a KRI is to provide forward-looking insight into how a given risk exposure is changing over time through early warning metrics. Illustrating upward or downward trends in leading risk indicators allows stakeholders to make proactive decisions before threats materialize or become unmanageable.

Selected Answer: D
D. Illustrating changes in risk trends.

Key risk indicators (KRIs) are used to provide early warning signs of potential problems and changes in risk conditions. The ability of a KRI to illustrate changes in risk trends is crucial because it allows decision-makers to identify shifts in risk levels and take appropriate actions in a timely manner. When a KRI can effectively show changes in risk trends, it provides valuable information for making informed decisions and taking proactive measures to mitigate or manage risks.

While the other characteristics listed (A, B, and C) may have their importance in specific contexts, the ability to illustrate changes in risk trends is typically the primary purpose of a KRI and the most critical for decision-making.

choices.D: Obtain vendor references from existing customers
choices.B: Review vendor service level agreement (SLA) metrics.

The best recommendation to address this situation is to de-identify data before being transferred to the test environment. It is important to protect personal information in accordance with relevant data protection and privacy laws and regulations.
